thread.title: Twitter to sack hundreds of employees in massive 'streamlining' exercise
thread.title_full: Twitter to sack hundreds of employees in massive 'streamlining' exercise - Mirror Online

author: Jasper Hamill
title: Twitter to sack hundreds of employees in massive 'streamlining' exercise
text:
The social media giant Twitter has revealed plans to sack more than 300 people, amounting to an estimated 8% of its total workforce.
It announced the potentially controversial "streamlining" scheme in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
A total of 336 people are expected to get the boot, although Twitter vowed to "go to great lengths to take care of each individual by providing generous exit packages and help finding a new job".
“Product and Engineering are going to make the most significant structural changes to reflect our plan ahead,” CEO Jack Dorsey wrote.
AFP Twitter co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey
“We feel strongly that Engineering will move much faster with a smaller and nimbler team, while remaining the biggest percentage of our workforce. And the rest of the organization will be streamlined in parallel.”
Twitter is expected to shell out up to $15 million in severance payments.
Stock in the social network shot up after the announcement, rising by up to 3% this morning.
Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey was named the new Twitter CEO earlier this month - a job he was sacked from just 7 years ago.
His predecessor, Dick Costolo, quit the social network just months after he admitted that Twitter "sucks" at dealing with abusive behaviour and content .
Twitter has been unable to win its battle against trolls, whose campaign of abuse recently prompted the Find Madeleine campaign to close its account due to "continuous abuse and negativity".
